snippet: The Detroit Institute of Arts is not a named beneficiary in the will of A. Alfred Taubman, a former owner of Sotheby’s who helped shape the museum, but it may benefit from his private foundation in coming years.
abstract: The Detroit Institute of Arts is not a named beneficiary in the will of A. Alfred Taubman, a former owner of Sotheby’s who helped shape the museum, but it may benefit from his private foundation in coming years.

byline.original: By COLIN MOYNIHAN and MARY M. CHAPMAN

headline.main: For Now, Taubman Sale Means No Gift for Detroit Museum
headline.print_headline: No Gift in Detroit, for Now
